cont.entity_a: Significantly improved the quality of my photos. Pictures are very sharp and it performs well in low light. Produces excellent images with a great depth of field.
cont.entity_b: Images are sharp with vivid colors. Great image quality and well-built. Takes sharp pictures even in low light.

cont.entity_a: Autofocus is not supported on the Nikon D5600; requires manual focus. The autofocus is slow and noisy as it relies on the camera's motor. Manual focus is necessary on cameras without an autofocus motor.
cont.entity_b: Focus is fast and accurate. Does not focus automatically for close-up shots.

cont.entity_a: Build quality feels cheap and it is lightweight. The lens is well-built but feels cheaply made with loose tolerances.
cont.entity_b: Heavy with all-metal and glass construction. Fast and solid lens.

cont.entity_a: The lens is not compatible with entry-level Nikon cameras without a focus motor.
It has a good price value and is a great addition to a camera bag.

cont.entity_b: Slight barrel distortion on crop sensor cameras, easily corrected in post. Some distortion, but easily corrected with photo software.

cont.entity_a: Great for portraits on DX cameras, but not suitable for full-frame cameras. The lens performs better on crop sensor cameras than on full frame.
cont.entity_b: Versatile focal length and great in low light for video and photography. Good for landscapes and architecture photography. Fixed focal length but versatile for wide-angle shots.

cont.entity_a: The lens does not come with instructions, making initial setup challenging.
Some minor sun flares occur when shooting around sunrise or sunset.
cont.entity_b: Lens prone to flaring; a lens hood is recommended.
Great in low light for video and photography. Works well in low light and tight spaces.
